{{Wikipedia|Hoko (doll)}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|ほう|こ}}
{{IPAchar|/hauko/}} → {{IPAchar|/hɔːko/}} → {{IPAchar|/hoːko/}}

Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ほうこ|這う|tr1=hau|t1=to crawl|子|tr2=ko|t2=child}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|ほうこ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|這う子}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ほうこ|hhira=はふこ}}

# a {{l|en|crawling}} {{l|en|baby}}
# a {{l|en|protective}} {{l|en|charm}} for babies, made as a {{l|en|doll}} in the form of a {{l|en|baby}}, and intended to take on any {{l|en|misfortune}} in the real baby's {{l|en|stead}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=ほうこ|rare}} alternate name for {{m|ja|犬蓬|tr=inu yomogi|lit=dog mugwort}}: {{taxlink|Artemisia keiskeana|species|noshow=1}}, a kind of {{l|en|mugwort}} or {{l|en|wormwood}}
